def main():
    # parse input
    t = int(input())
    for i in range(t):
        n = int(input())
        a = list(map(int, input().split()))
        # solve
        print(solve(a))

def solve(a):
    # we can remove any one of the two numbers if they are equal
    # so we can remove them all in one move
    if len(set(a)) == 1:
        return "YES"
    # if there is only one unique number in the array
    # we can remove it
    if len(set(a)) == 2:
        return "YES"
    # if there are three unique numbers in the array
    # we must have at least one of each number
    # so we cannot remove them all
    return "NO"

if __name__ == "__main__":
    main()
